chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to a Witness

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J. Charette (DOC #490051) Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Battery or Threat to a Witness, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Court costs and surcharges totaling $518.00.  Cash bond applied from 14CF63.
AODA Assessment and follow through on all recommendations of Counselor.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Mental health assessment and follow through with all recommendations.
No contact with Renee T.  As a convicted felon, prohibited from possessing a firearm.  As convicted felon, prohibited to vote until civil rights restored.
Defendant is to submit DNA sample.

supervisions.notes: If probation/extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert J. Charette (DOC #490051) Jr.
Current: PO Box 661, c/o Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 07-06-2015)
Prior: 89440 Blueberry Road, Bayfield, WI 54814
Motion hearing at 07-09-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Robert J. Charette in court with attorney Craig Haukaas.  Defendant Robert J. Charette in custody.  Frederick Ian Bourg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bayfield County cases 14CF62 and 14CF63.  Hearing started at 1:40 p.m.  Motion for return of property.  Atty Haukaas requests property seized at the time of arrest.  DA objects to hearing; motion filed 14CV80.  That matter has not been resolved yet, 2 days ago amended motion to add these two criminal cases.  Subpoena of Witnesses not prepared/mailed; only given 2 days notice.  State asserts the property was in maintaining a drug house; cash on list of property to return.  Judge asks for 14CV80 case.  Break taken for Clerk to retrieve file.  After review of file, Court takes notice of the civil file; assigned to Judge Robert Eaton.  Civil case does have a scheduling order signed by Judge Eaton, questions Atty Haukaas why he should hear the motion today?  Atty Haukaas responds; scheduled with Judge's JA.  Court again questions why motion should be heard today?  Atty Haukaas indicated the civil case does not include the personal property, only the defendant's vehicle.  DA argues the original motion filed with civil case number.  Seeking return of two firearms and defendant is a convicted felon.  Seeking return of pills and paraphernalia; need more info.  Atty Haukaas indicates NOH with language on what will be heard today.  Seeking return of money, telephone, blackberry, one firearm belongs to brother and the second firearm turned over to sister, money bundles and safety deposit keys.  Court;$1577.00.  DA would like to do a background check on siblings willing to take firearms.  Court goes over each item w/ Attys:  safety deposit keys, DA no objection; bundle paper bands, DA no objection; small containers, DA would have interest only if residue, Mr. Charette's items and want back; blackberry, DA would need to talk with officer Cadotte unknown if continues to be evidence, DCI is involved; Court, all pills return is denied, pill bottles return is denied, Rx bottle with no label can be returned; #10 not returned, #11, #12, #13, #14 cannot be returned; #15, #16 are keys can be returned; #17 smoking pipe is contraband; #18 can be returned; #19 and #20,#21, #22, #23, #24, #25, #26, #27, #28 not to be returned; cash, 12 gauge and 22 rifle.  Vehicle will be taken up in the civil case.  Firearms are dangerous weapons, recites stats covering dangerous weapons.  Court questions if cash, telephone and firearms are evidence in any other investigation; DA unknown as of today.  Questions if cash in drug dealing forfeited?  Atty Haukaas responds; DA not required to file petition to seize.  Court, DA will need to get witnesses here.  Atty Haukaas to prepare order of the Court regarding items decided so far.  Still need to decide on cash, telephone, firearms.    DA requests the Court he be transported to prison.  Defendant can appear by v/c for next hearing, 07-09-2015 at 10 a.m.
